snippet: The companies are required to be doing business within six months, meaning medical marijuana could be on sale in New York before the end of the year.
abstract: New York State Health Dept announces names of five organizations that will be allowed to grow and sell marijuana for medical use, each of which plans to open four dispensaries across the state, including in New York City; authorization to sell stems from law signed by Gov Andrew M Cuomo in 2014; companies can only sell drug that is made in-state.

byline.contributor: Michael Wilson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The companies are required to be doing business within six months, meaning medical marijuana could be on sale in New York before the end of the year.

headline.main: New York State Awards 5 Medical Marijuana Licenses
headline.print_headline: New York State Picks 5 Companies to Grow and Sell Medical Marijuana
